titleStmt.title: A discourse concerning the East-India trade Wherein is shewed by arguments taken from a treatise written by Sir Josiah Child, reprinted this present year 1693, that the said trade may be carried on by a regulated company, to much greater advantage of the publick, than by a company with a joint-stock.

A discourse concerning the East-India trade Wherein is shewed by arguments taken from a treatise written by Sir Josiah Child, reprinted this present year 1693, that the said trade may be carried on by a regulated company, to much greater advantage of the publick, than by a company with a joint-stock.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Richard Baldwin, near Oxford Arms Inn Warwick Lane,

notesStmt.note: Copy filmed at reel 2494 tightly bound, with some loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
